alert.note: Alert for Houston (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 13 at 9:56AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .Thunderstorms are expected through at least the morning hours. Some areas may see repeat thunderstorms with high rainfall rates and totals in the 3 to 6 inch range. This could lead to flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Minnesota, including the following counties, Dodge, Fillmore, Houston, Mower, Olmsted, Wabasha and Winona. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms are expected through at least the morning hours. Some areas may see repeat thunderstorms with high rainfall rates and totals in the 3 to 6 inch range. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
